contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract nouns "wisdom" and "understanding" can be translated as adjective phrases, and the abstract noun "sight" refers to how the peoples judge or decide on the value of something. Alternate translation: "this is what will show the peoples that you are wise and that you understand what is important" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "faithfulness" can be stated as "faithfully" or "faithful." Alternate translation: "faithfully loving thousands, those who love me" or "being faithful to the covenant with thousands, with those who love me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: showing covenant faithfulness to thousands, to those who love me

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "assembly" can be expressed as the verb "gather together." Alternate translation: "on the day when you Israelites all came and met together in one place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: on the day of the assembly

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "blessing" can be translated with a verb. Alternate translation: "God will bless you if you obey" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: the blessing, if you obey

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "the rest" can be stated as a verb. Alternate translation: "to the land where you will rest" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: to the rest

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "rebellion" can be stated as a verb. Alternate translation: "he has tried to make you rebel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: he has spoken rebellion

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "investigation" can be stated as a verb. Alternate translation: "you must carefully investigate what happened" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: you must make a careful investigation

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "advice" can be stated as a verb. Alternate translation: "you will ask them to advise you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: you will seek their advice

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "verdict" can be stated as a verb. Alternate translation: "they will decide on the matter" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: they will give you the verdict

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "reputation" can be translated as a verb phrase. Alternate translation: "makes other people think she is a bad person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: puts a bad reputation on her

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract nouns "proof" and "virginity" can be translated with verbal phrases. Alternate translation: "must take something that proves that she has never had sexual relations" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: must take proof of her virginity

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract nouns "proof" and "virginity" can be translated as verb phrases. Alternate translation: "Your daughter could not prove that she has never had sexual relations" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: I did not find in your daughter the proof of virginity

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract nouns "proof" and "virginity" can be translated as verb phrases. Alternate translation: "But this proves that my daughter has never had sexual relations" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: But here is the proof of my daughter's virginity

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "reputation" can be translated as a verb phrase. Alternate translation: "has caused people to think that a virgin of Israel is a bad person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: has caused a bad reputation for a virgin of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract nouns "proof" and "virginity" can be translated as verb phrases. Alternate translation: "something that proves that the girl has never had sexual relations" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: the proof of virginity

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract nouns "delicateness" and "tenderness" can be stated as adjectives. Alternate translation: "because she is so delicate and tender" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: for delicateness and tenderness

contextId.occurrenceNote: "free you from your captivity." The abstract noun "captivity" can be translated as a verbal clause. Alternate translation: "free you from those who had captured you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: reverse your captivity

contextId.occurrenceNote: This abstract noun can be translated as a verb. Alternate translation: "that the enemy would provoke me" or "that the enemy would cause me to be angry" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: the provocation of the enemy

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "fate" can be translated as a verb. Alternate translation: "what is going to happen to them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: their coming fate

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "justice" can be translated as an adjective or as an adverb. Alternate translation: "For Yahweh will do what is just for his people" or "For Yahweh will act justly towards his people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: For Yahweh will give justice to his people

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "help" can be translated as a verb. Alternate translation: "help him to fight" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: be a help

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstact noun "security" can be translated using a verb phrase. Alternate translation: "lives where no one can harm him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: lives in security

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "refuge," which means a shelter or a place safe from danger, can be stated as a verb. Alternate translation: "The eternal God will protect his people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: The eternal God is a refuge
